parameters: \pop[2]I enter the Triple R, and find Isaac sitting at a nearby table.
\pop[2]Again, it's weird how much I've been here lately. A home away from home.
\pop[2]Maybe I'll order something light, and try to save money for The Wayfarer.
\pop[2]This is our first date, though. So maybe I should order something special.
\pop[2]Anxiety rises within me as I face that simple fact.
\pop[2]I'm sure I'll be fine, though. We're already good friends.
\pop[2]And they always say that's how a good relationship starts, right?
\pop[2]Isaac waves me over with a big smile on his face.
\pop[2]I'm happy to be here, after planning this last time we talked.
\pop[2]It always felt good to make plans that people followed through on.
I was just looking over my invitation to \c[23]Argus\c[0] HQ.
Something tells me this promotion is already mine.
\pop[2]Oh, right, he was up for a promotion within \c[23]Argus\c[0].
\pop[2]I remember hearing about that a couple times since I moved here.
\pop[2]But this time, there was some paranoia associated with it, due to current events.
\pop[3]I'm a bit nervous to meet some of these higher-ups, though.
I've only ever seen their names and titles in mass emails.
So it's almost like they're these figures from folklore.
\pop[3]But I know that they're people just like me.
And maybe one day \c[14]I'll\c[0] be the one sending those emails.
Believe it or not, I've contributed a lot to the company during my service.
\pop[2]He tilts his head toward the window, and I turn to look outside.
I helped \c[23]Argus\c[0] optimize the code that they run on.
Before my update, they \c[14]definitely\c[0] weren't as efficient.
\pop[3]That's the cool thing about computers, though.
They don't have to think before acting. They can just... act.
If the code is good enough, they can run purely on instinct.
\pop[3]Or at least, whatever the machine equivalent of instinct is.
After my update, the litter in the streets really tapered off.
You think that'd satisfy me, but I keep reaching higher.
\pop[3]That's why I'm so excited about this opportunity.
But given the whole Kyron situation, I'm also scared.
I tell myself that my actions are morally sound. It seems to help.
\pop[3]It just reminds me of this old saying I used to hear:
"It's better to fall for your own beliefs than cave in the face of others'".
But we should change the subject, anyways. Far too grim for me.
\pop[3]And I'd rather not have our first date affected by things like that.
You know me, though. The world's leading expert on rambling.
But if we're dating, at least now we can have anxiety together.
\pop[2]I turn back to face him, and he smiles at me.
\pop[2]I didn't know he actually contributed \c[14]that\c[0] much to \c[23]Argus\c[0].
\pop[2]Maybe he really was held back by wasting his days in retail.
\pop[2]He looks down at his phone, but tilts his head toward the drones once more.
\pop[2]As he starts to tap away at his device, they start to move back and forth.
\pop[2]It's clear he was in control, making them do a sort of "dance".
For testing optimal flight paths, and observing the city.
Or in this case, to make myself look \c[14]extra\c[0] cool.
\pop[2]I ask him if he's allowed to do this at will.
\pop[2]Showing off shouldn't have to get him in trouble, after all.
\pop[3]Yup! I'm allowed to play with them whenever I want.
Of course, it's supposed to be in the name of optimization.
Every month, I have to give \c[23]Argus\c[0] more effective flight paths.
\pop[3]You'd think after a while, I couldn't optimize them anymore.
But \c[23]Argus\c[0] doesn't believe in that. Everything could always be "better".
Helping them with stuff like this definitely got me in the running for my promotion.
\pop[2]All of a sudden, I hope that he gets the job. His passion is unmatched.
\pop[2]I just also hope that it remains unaffected by our recent "side" endeavors.
\pop[2]Losing your future in a battle for positive change was never really a good thing.
\pop[2]He shrugs right after this exchange, unsure of what should happen next.
\pop[3]Well then, what should we talk about...?
Maybe our trip to The Wayfarer this weekend?
In retrospect, it'll actually be the perfect night for me.
\pop[3]Bomb my interview? I can drink to cope.
Nail it? Then I'll drink to celebrate.
And I'll be with my friends, too.
Sorry, I guess I'll have to get used to that one.
Especially with all the teasing that's sure to come with it.
\pop[2]He shakes his head, as if he realized he was rambling again.
\pop[3]Maybe you wanna contribute to the conversation?
I'm curious how things have been treating \c[14]you\c[0], Delta.
Especially when it comes to Dante, Taylor, and Klace.
\pop[2]I tell him that things have been going good, aside from the current paranoia.
\pop[2]Getting to spend one-on-one tme with everybody definitely helped.
\pop[2]In our group settings, sometimes sarcasm and snark got in the way.
\pop[3]Yeah, we do love to joke with one another.
But more private things like this definitely help with bonding.
I hang out with the others like this, too. You should definitely keep it up.
\pop[2]I nod, and let him know that I plan to.
\pop[2]I'm actually supposed to hang out with Taylor tomorrow.
\pop[2]It'll be the first time I see his house. I'm actually kind of excited.
\pop[3]Oh, of course. An invitation to Taylor's house.
I'm sure you can tell what he's expecting, right?
He did the exact same thing to \c[14]me\c[0] when we first met.
You're still free to live your life, even if we're dating.
No need to hold each other back from fun stuff like that.
\pop[2]Yeah, Taylor was definitely transparent about what he wanted.
\pop[2]Dante hadn't really shown an interest in me that way, though.
\pop[3]Really? You should see the stuff he says in my DM's.
Maybe he's just too shy to put the moves on you.
But I think he wants to. Pretty bad, actually.
\pop[2]Dante has moves...? I mean, maybe he's idly flirted with me...
\pop[2]But I hardly felt him making "advances" like the others.
I know almost everything there is to know about these people.
Well, except for Klace and Kyron. They're relatively new.
\pop[3]But if you ever have any questions, feel free to ask.
As long as it doesn't turn into gossip, I'll answer.
That's not really my style. Gotta stay in the lines.
\pop[2]As intrigued as I am, I didn't come here to talk about other people.
\pop[2]I came here to talk to him, and get to know him better.
\pop[2]I remind him that this is \c[14]our\c[0] first date.
\pop[3]Well, I guess I'm an open book.
Is there something you'd like to talk about?
Better hand you the wheel before I steer off course again.
\pop[2]Actually, there has been a thing or two on my mind.
\pop[2]Ever since I arrived, his vision has been hinted at a couple times.
\pop[2]It seems to be more and more relevant, so I think I want to know about it.
\pop[3]Wow. I guess I should've expected that.
There's \c[14]one\c[0] thing that I'd rather not talk about, and you pick it.
Turns out I'm not as much of an open book as I thought. Sorry.
\pop[2]It's fine. I'd never force him to speak about his vision.
\pop[2]That's why I told him to only talk about it if he's comfortable.
\pop[2]Perhaps one day he'll open up about it, though. It's quite intriguing.
\pop[2]A bright future, and one linked to our current situation with Kyron?
\pop[2]Part of me just assumes that this all ends in our favor.
\pop[2]But it really couldn't be that simple, could it?
\pop[3]I'd rather get to know each other better, if that's okay with you.
You know, who we are here and now, and where we came from.
A lot better than talking about a future that might not happen, right?
\pop[2]And if we were going to date, we'd face the future together anyways.
\pop[2]So we might as well strengthen our bond here in the present.
\pop[2]I decide to ask him about that jacket he's always wearing.
\pop[2]Taylor picked on him for it, and he even seems to wear it at work.
\pop[2]Everything implied that it had some sort of deeper meaning to him.
\pop[3]Oh, yeah. I guess I do wear it a lot.
Taylor only picks on me \c[14]because\c[0] he knows it's meaningful.
But it was just given to me from someone special in the past.
\pop[3]Fit them a lot better than it does me, though.
That's why I keep saying I'll grow into it.
I don't just mean it physically, you know.
\pop[2]That makes sense to me. It's kind of like filling someone else's shoes.
\pop[2]Or perhaps feeling worthy enough to carry on someone's legacy.
\pop[3]Have you ever had something that makes you feel safe, or comfortable?
I guess it's kind of like that. A memento, or souvenir from the past.
Dante has some old wallet, while I have this jacket. Pretty simple.
\pop[2]True. Dante did have a wallet, and those things were pretty obsolete.
\pop[2]At least Isaac's memento was stylish, and made him look good.
\pop[2]I voice that sentiment, and he blushes almost immediately.
\pop[3]Glad to know I can pull it off.
I thought I always came second to \c[14]your\c[0] sense of style.
You didn't have to dress up for this, you know. It's pretty casual.
\pop[2]A first date is special to me, so I wanted to dress the part.
\pop[2]I didn't go overboard, but I did my best to look good.
\pop[2]Presentation is important. At least, that's what I was taught.
\pop[2]I always do my best to look good.
\pop[2]Presentation is important. At least, that's what I was taught.
\pop[3]Oh yeah. Speaking of what you were taught...
I thought I'd ask you about your life back at home.
Or, your old home, I guess. If you're comfortable.
\pop[3]Wow, really? I didn't know it was like that.
Probably for the best that you left it behind, then.
Didn't mean to drum up any bad memories. I apologize.
\pop[2]I tell him it's fine, and that it's important to open up from time to time.
\pop[2]There's obviously a few things that he's been holding back on purpose, too.
\pop[2]I'm in no rush to find out, but I tell him we should never be afraid to talk to each other.
\pop[2]I think my implication is pretty clear. That he can trust me with his vision.
\pop[2]He reaches across the table, and holds out his hand.
\pop[2]I place mine in his, and he squeezes it softly.
\pop[3]Oh, trust me, I know. It just takes courage, that's all.
But I think I'll have plenty of that on New Year's Eve.
I plan to tap into it, and make our bond even stronger.
\pop[2]It works for me, and actually makes me more excited.
\pop[2]The Quantum Leap is starting to sound better and better.
\pop[2]Taylor had a good idea. It should catch on and become a thing.
\pop[2]Of course, that's just the hopeful part of me talking.
\pop[2]It could easily just devolve into a night of drunken debauchery.
\pop[2]And something tells me that Taylor wouldn't mind that at all.
\pop[2]Isaac raises my hand up, and gives the top of it a soft kiss.
\pop[2]Isaac yawns, and stretches, before giving me another smile.
\pop[2]I feel like I know him better now. Especially about work, and his past.
\pop[2]As vague as he was, I'm sure the gaps would be filled later on.
\pop[2]He grabs the menu by his side, and opens it up with a groan.
